results.title: We're here to stay
results.creator_credit: Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “West”.
That is the resolve of Agri-Pool, seven farm families in Lestock, Saskatchewan, who have pooled their resources so that rising operating costs will not drive them off their land. By pooling their land, their equipment, their livestock, and farming as a cooperative, they are able to live as they choose, to maintain their standard of living, and even to have some spare time left over to enjoy. This is an engaging look at a novel approach to big-scale farming.

results.title: Cattle ranch
results.creator_credit: Guy L. Cote, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The life of the cowboy, filmed through the seasons on Canada’s biggest cattle ranch near Kanloops, British Colombia. With musical accompaniment by American folk singer Peter Seeger and narration by Frances Hyland, ‘Cattle Ranch’ presents a vividly dramatic picture of the open range where a cowboy is king, where calves are born, live with the herd for a time in the splendour of mountain meadows, then join the trek to the city abattoir. Awards: Locarno; Rome; Vancouver; Montreal

results.brief_description: This series looks at the main issues facing children in regards to the care and treatment of the most popular animals they may wish to keep as pets. Suitable for Middle-Upper Primary level students.

results.title: Cast away [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Robert Zemeckis, Jack Rapke, Steve Starkey, Tom Hanks, NBCUniversal and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Tom Hanks stars as Chuck Noland, a FedEx systems engineer whose workaholic tendencies doesn’t leave him much time for his family or long suffering girlfriend (Helen Hunt). When a horrific plane crash (executed with ferocious intensity by director Robert Zemeckis) leaves him stranded on a deserted island, the time obsessed Noland must now learn how to live at a different pace. Zemeckis and Hanks (who conceived the original idea) carefully map out the daily toils Noland must now face, from how to get food and water, to the growing sense of isolation the solitary Noland struggles with. Screen writer William Broyles Jnr’s solution to his loneliness is to create an unlikely man Friday, a volleyball washed ashore and christened Wilson by the grateful cast away. Zemeckis wisely chooses to play out the island sequences in virtual silence, doing away with most of the film score and Hanks dialogue. “Cast Away” inevitably becomes a familiar triumph of the human spirit tale, however it’s FedEx that ultimately triumphs, receiving one of the more generous product-placements in recent film memory. Cast includes Nick Searcy and Chris Noth.

results.title: Cats
results.creator_credit: Alan Degen and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of pets”.
This video explores the life of a housecat, from the time of its birth, through its early months of development to adulthood. It explores a cats ability to always land on its feet, its natural agility and flexibility. Also explained are the cat’s mechanisms of perception and communication; the use of the tongue, specialised scent glands, ears and whiskers and its voice. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teachers guide included.

results.title: World of pets : Fish
results.creator_credit: Dennis B. Kane and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of pets”.
This film explores the world of fish by demonstrating to students how to set up an aquarium and how to care for goldfish, as well as a practical discussion of the anatomy, perception and breeding behaviour of fish. Students will discover that fish not only make colourful pets but that they also can be used to explore animal behaviour and to teach responsibility. Suitable for Middle-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.

results.title: World of pets : dogs
results.creator_credit: Chris Brown and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of pets”.
This film explores the world of the dog as a companion to humans. By focussing on a golden retriever and her puppies, from birth to maturity, we observe the dog’s behaviour as it interacts with other dogs and the human family which adopts it. Suitable for Middle-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.

results.title: Casey
results.creator_credit: Neil Munro, Tom Haydon and ABC
results.brief_description: This film is a view of the life and career of the former Governor-General of Australia, Lord Casey. It is the first film about Lord Casey and covers the span of years from his birth in Brisbane in 1890 to his installation as a Knight of Garter at Windsor Castle nearly eighty years later. Following on from his political career which included such appointments as Treasurer in the Lyons government, Minister of Supply and Development in the first Menzies government, six years of World War II as the first Australian Minister to the United States and eventually Minister for External Affairs, Lord Casey finally became Governor-General of Australia in 1966. Photographers: Les Wesley, John Atkinson, Ron Bollman, David Brill.

results.title: World of Pets
results.creator_credit: Alan Degen, Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Each program looks at a particular pet and shows how you can learn about animal behavior through the care of animals. The programs also give tips on how to look after pets.
